project_descr: Peace Through Development (PTD) : Provide a framework for UNDP's continued response to post conflct needs in the provices of North Maluku, Maluku and Central Sulawesi.

outputs.output_descr: All three provinces have experienced major inter-group conflict since 1999. PTD is a five year programme commencing in 2005 that aims for enhanced capacity of government and civil society to formulate and implement policies and programmes on crisis sensitive development. Focusing primarily on selected districts and municipalities in the three provinces it focuses on two main areas of capacity development: 1) strengthened governance capacity to support long-term conflict prevention and peace building; and 2) social integration and peace-building promoted through sustainable solutions for displaced and returnee communities and improved livelihood opportunities.

Strenghtened governance capacity to support long-term conflct prevenction and peace building within Provincial and districts capacity for conflict-sensitive participatory planning and policy dialougue strenghtened in three provinces Maluku, North Maluku and Central Sulwesi within piloting project in 24 villages.

Social Integration and Peace Building promoted through sustainable solutions for displaced and returnee communities and improved livelihood opportinities in three provinces Maluku, North Maluku and Central Sulawesi within piloting projects in 24 sub vilages.
